definition: to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
cicada
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet

sentences.english: Liston had been world champion for two years, and was deemed by many to be invincible.
sentences.chinese: 那时利斯顿已经蝉联了两年世界冠军，公认所向无敌。

sentences.english: Germany retained the Women's World Cup title.
sentences.chinese: 在本届女足世界杯上，德国击败巴西，蝉联冠军。

sentences.english: She's running to defend her 400 metres title.
sentences.chinese: 她为蝉联400米冠军而参赛。

sentences.english: Anakin pitted his racing talents against the undefeated champion, Sebulba.
sentences.chinese: 阿纳金发挥他的赛艇天赋，对抗蝉联冠军萨布巴。

sentences.english: Has any team since been good enough to win two in a row since Milan?
sentences.chinese: 之后还有哪支球队和AC一样好足以蝉联冠军杯吗？

sentences.english: But a second year atop the Dow is unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 但是美国运通不大可能蝉联道琼斯榜首。

sentences.english: St. Paulo won the second straight Toyota Cup in Tokyo yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 圣保罗队昨天在东京第二次蝉联“丰田杯”。

sentences.english: If I win tonight, it will be my third straight victory this year.
sentences.chinese: 如果今晚我赢了，这将是我今年第三次蝉联冠军。

sentences.english: This is Forbes' third go-round this year at putting Winfrey at the top of some list or other.
sentences.chinese: 这是奥普拉今年第三次蝉联福布斯排行榜冠军。

definition: (of a list, music chart etc) to reach the top
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
top of the list
to be located at
be honored with
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to rank
the charts (of best-sellers)/table of ranking
top three
variant of 榜[bang3]
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
champion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to rise (in society)
to monopolize/to take on responsibility over everything/to undertake the whole task
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
